title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 17, 2019).

House Republicans deserted Trump to oppose his withdrawal of troops from Syria, a prelude to a rancorous White House meeting with congressional leaders in which the president insulted Democrats before they walked out.

Houston Rockets executive Morey was the target of what appears to be a coordinated campaign by pro-China troll accounts after his tweet about Hong Kong.

Hong Kong's leader was forced to deliver her annual policy speech by video after being shouted down by pro-democracy lawmakers.

Energy Secretary Perry said he sought out Giuliani this spring at Trump's direction to address the president's concerns about alleged Ukrainian corruption.

A former Pompeo adviser told lawmakers he left his post over frustration with the treatment of the ousted U.S. ambassador to Ukraine.

The U.K. and EU were on the brink of a draft Brexit deal, although London's doubts about winning Parliament's backing remained an obstacle to an agreement.

The U.S. is resuming some financial aid to three Central American countries after a drop in arrests of families and children caught crossing the southwest border illegally.

Chicago teachers will begin a strike Thursday over demands going beyond pay.

Suicide and homicide rates have increased in recent years among young people in the U.S., a report says.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 17, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
